item.description:
An event for Minilympic teams only. Please do not RSVP unless you are registered in the Minilympics roster.

This event will be an elimination style tournament. Each round, player(s) with the lowest score will be eliminated until we have a winner or winners.

This event is worth 20 points for 1st place, 15 points for 2nd place and 10 points for third place. All teams will receive 5 points for participating.

 

The Game: Anomia is like the opposite of what a trivia game should be.  While most trivia games require thoughtful deliberation over obscure facts and questions, this game challenges you to come up with simple concepts, such as a kind of fruit or household pet.  However, before you go thinking you are smarter than a fifth grader, what should seemingly be child's play becomes intense when you don't know when you are going to be called upon to answer and you have milliseconds to come up with it.   A game that requires you to think on your feet in more ways than one, and beloved by the founder of this group makes Anomia an excellent entry in our Reflex event.

Tournament will run from 6pm to 10pm for 12 players.  If you wish to participate as a spectator, please say so in the comments and we will have room on a first come, first serve basis for 4 people.

 

*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
Did you know? (A Tribute to Gaming around the World):

Canada's claim to fame: Cody Lombardo, a teenage Canadian, was recorded in the 2009 Guinness Book of World Records after he won a 1,150 person tournament of Rock, Paper, Scissors.
